intro: Rhynchospora albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces white or pale yellow flowers with distinctive margins. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
